column4: Can anyone help me getting wireless up running on my Ubuntu ?? :)
which card (chip)?
A Intel PRO/Wireless 2200BG
It is in the device manager, i just need to configure the wireless setup..
I just cant make it work
Because i got no encryption, but there is not a "No encryption" option in the setup
can you post /etc/network/interfaces in pastebin?
No, Acces Denied
use sudo less /etc/network/interfaces and copy paste
Im not sure what u mean, i just installed my first Linux based system EVER, and i asked u guys for some help. :)
Cant it be done using the Interface, insted of the Terminal thing ?
does System>Admin>Network work for you?
Yes indead. :)
Then i choose Wireless Connection, and configure. i enter the network name, and then i have to choose some kind of encryption.. But i dont have encryption, so what do i do ?
Then i choose Wireless Connection, and configure. i enter the network name, and then i have to choose some kind of encryption.. But i dont have encryption, so what do i do ?
you do not have any encryption? maybe leaving the fields empty will do the trick
No i dont. I tried leaving the key field empty, but it couldnt find the network.. I can choose 2 kinds of encryption, ASCI and something else.. some Decimal thing
Do i have to add some DNS server or something ? Or should it do that automaticly with the DHCP ?
what are you trying to connect to? a router?
A accespoint
i guess so...
But, when its on wireless, i cant get acces with VNC
